**Discharge Letter:**

Patient Name: Benjamin Davis  
Age: 70  
Admission Date: 11th of August, 2023  
Discharge Date: August 20, 2023  

Dear Dr. Thompson,

I am writing to notify you of the discharge of Mr. Benjamin Davis, a 70-year-old male who was admitted to our hospital on the 11th of August, 2023. Mr. Davis presented with complaints of acute onset confusion, weakness, and difficulty walking.

During his hospitalization, Mr. Davis underwent a thorough neurological evaluation, including brain imaging studies and cerebrospinal fluid analysis. The findings revealed evidence of acute ischemic stroke involving the right middle cerebral artery territory.

On the 12th of August, 2023, Mr. Davis received intravenous thrombolytic therapy with tissue plasminogen activator (tPA) within the window period for acute stroke treatment. He was subsequently started on antiplatelet therapy and statins to prevent recurrent stroke and optimize his neurologic recovery.

Throughout his hospital stay, Mr. Davis received intensive rehabilitation therapy, including physical, occupational, and speech therapy, to improve his mobility, strength, and communication skills. He made significant progress during his hospitalization and demonstrated functional improvement in activities of daily living.

After nine days of hospitalization, Mr. Davis's condition stabilized, and he was discharged home on August 20, 2023. He was provided with a prescription for secondary stroke prevention medications, instructions for home exercises, and referrals to outpatient rehabilitation services for continued therapy and support.

We anticipate a favorable recovery for Mr. Davis and recommend close outpatient follow-up to monitor his neurologic status and functional progress.

Sincerely,

[Physician's Signature]  
Dr. Emily Thompson  
Neurologist
